did.unittitle: Manucript
"Fruit and Nut Trees: An Arbor-Day-Plea"

scopecontent.p: [Tipped into booklet.]

did.unittitle: Letters
Edward Payson Roeto Charles Mumford

scopecontent.p: [Encloses [manuscript ?]; indicates his willingness to cut it if it is too long; invites him to visit; writes that he will soon send a check for $20.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Charles W. [Squires]

scopecontent.p: [Sends autograph in response to request for [Squire's] collection of "Knights of the Quill."]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto A. H. Holloway

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for "interesting volume."]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Frank S. Wood

scopecontent.p: [Expresses thanks for being honored by Wood's Society.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Editors, Youth's Companion

scopecontent.p: [Outlines a story of a war refugee family based on Memoirs of the War of the Revolution in the Southern Dept. of the United States; indicates his desire to produce what the editors want and to cooperate in every way; hopes for sufficient remuneration as he is financially pressed.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto [Samuel Sidney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Approves circular and hopes to hear from McClure about his sister's [ Mary Abigail Roe] story as well as his own.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto S[amuel] S[idney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Writes that, because of the volume of other work, he must know when the requested piece would be required and what he would receive for it before making a commitment.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto [Samuel Sidney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Writes that Current, which had been publishing a story of his, failed; fears he will suffer financial loss as a result; states that failure has impelled him to write " Significant Hummingbirds, " which he describes, to recoup losses; offers to sell it for $200.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto S[amuel] S[idney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Writes that, although he has had another offer for [" Significant Hummingbirds"], he has awaited McClure's response; sends the manuscript and points out its timeliness, because much criticism is being expressed of "wearing little birds."]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto [Samuel Sidney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Excuses his delay in replying because he was on a mountain excursion with [Henry Mills] Alden; accepts the rejection of his story and will try again.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto [Samuel Sidney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Writes that he will meet McClure in December to discuss requests; states he is reluctant to take on new commitments because of promised work; hopes to begin war stories shortly; explains that he must write when the mood strikes rather than promise "a certain length and at a certain time"; writes he must complete work for Harper's [Monthly]. ]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto S[amuel] S[idney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Explains the illness of his child prevented their planned meeting; requests a letter stating the type of work desired; states he will do his best but cannot meet demands as to length and completion date.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto [Samuel Sidney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [States that he is writing a book which will provide more income that short stories; writes he will communicate with McClure when he has more time for stories.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Perry, Mason & Co.

scopecontent.p: [Discusses a short story, which he has almost completed; writes he will submit it to [ Youth's Companion], his first attempt having been rejected; comments on a story which recently appeared in their publication which affected him deeply.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Editor, New YorkStar

scopecontent.p: [Discusses observance of the Sabbath and the role of Sunday newspapers; believes Sunday should be set apart from the rest of the week and publications should emphasize literature and articles leading to "higher thoughts . . . and better living" rather than business and crime.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Perry, Mason & Co.

scopecontent.p: [Expresses understanding of an editor's right to choose his material and accepts the rejection of his story, which he has submitted elsewhere; writes that he is "mulish enough" to try again.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto S[amuel] S[idney] McClure

scopecontent.p: [Writes that he has returned from Charlestonwith material for a story; states he will leave in 2 weeks for Santa Barbara, Californiawith his family; expects the railroad companies and Santa Barbarato profit from his literary work; hopes for financial concessions; explains that, having "endorsed for a relative and lost everything," he is in financial difficulty.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto F. B. Wright, [Editor, the Graphic News]

scopecontent.p: [Accepts, on behalf of his friend, whatever seems fair for the manuscript and photographs; believes the article will be an attractive feature in Wright's magazine.]

did.unittitle: Edward Payson Roeto Editor, Lippincott's Magazine

scopecontent.p: [Offers for publication a love story, " A Queen of Spades, " for which he asks $300 to be paid as soon as possible; reserves the right to publish in book form at a later date.]
